column4: I just got a new 250gig external usb hdd, do I need to format it, or can I just use it like a flash drive?
plug it in, what happens?
my system opens a file browser to it, that's why I was asking
that it is good, the file system has been found.
the system sees it as another drive.
yes, it opens as a blank drive that I have to unmount to unplug
ok, so you can play with it like any other storage device.
any ideas as to why gparted won't give me the option to resize the FAT32 partition of my external drive?
is it a Dell machine?
nope, it's an MSI laptop
do I need to unmount the drive do partition it?
yes.

my external drive now has a 118gig ext3 partition that my file browser labeled "disk" to copy a folder to it in the terminal I use "sudo cp -r path/to/folder /disk/folder" right? or is there a different path to the disk?
drag and drop?
I was going to try that but I didn't know if one "sudo nautilus" window and one "Places > disk" window would let me do that
go for it!
yeah, drag and drop gave me an error that moving to /media/disk didn't have the proper permissions
roger, kill nautilus, and in a terminal start it as gksudo nautilis.
crap the folder I want to move was created by vmware server and has a space in it, how do I get around spaces in file names in the terminal?
I don't know.
are you still on?
